SEARCH
Package com.example.omninventory

Class InventoryRepository

java.lang.Object
com.example.omninventory.InventoryRepository
public class InventoryRepository extends Object
Encapsulate behaviours related to Firestore, going from Firestore document to InventoryItem and vice-versa, etc.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor

    InventoryRepository()
    Constructor that sets up connection to Firestore and references.

    • addInventoryItem

      public void addInventoryItem(User currentUser, InventoryItem item)
      Add a new InventoryItem to the inventoryItem collection. Also adds reference to the current User's list of owned items.
      Parameters:
      currentUser - User currently signed in.
      item - InventoryItem to add to currentUser's owned items.

    • updateInventoryItem

      public void updateInventoryItem(InventoryItem item)
      Updates an InventoryItem in the database with new data. Effectively, this means overwriting the document at the firebaseId of the given InventoryItem with entirely new InventoryItem data.
      Parameters:
      item - The InventoryItem to update.

    • updateItemImages

      public void updateItemImages(ArrayList<ItemImage> prevImages, ArrayList<ItemImage> newImages)
      Given an ArrayList of the previous images held by an item and the images now held by that item (i.e. after the item is edited), this method compares the two lists, uploads any new images to storage, and deletes any old images from storage. Specifically: - An image that appears in prevImages but not newImages will be deleted from storage. - An image that appears in newImages but not prevImages will be uploaded to storage. This aims to minimize storage usage (by deleting unused images) and wasted upload time (by not uploading extra copies of the same image). Images are compared using their storagePath field, that is the path associated with the image in Firebase Storage. Any image that has not yet been uploaded to storage will have a storagePath attribute of null and will always be uploaded.
      Parameters:
      prevImages - The array of 'previous' images held by an InventoryItem before update.
      newImages - The array of 'new' images held by an InventoryItem after update.

    • addImages

      public ArrayList<String> addImages(ArrayList<ItemImage> images)
      Add a list of ItemImages to Firebase Storage.
      Parameters:
      images - The images to upload.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing the storage path of each image uploaded.

    • deleteImages

      public void deleteImages(ArrayList<ItemImage> images)

      Parameters:

    • attemptDownloadImage

      public void attemptDownloadImage(InventoryItem item, int pos, ImageDownloadHandler handler)

      Parameters:
      item -
      handler -

    • getInventoryItemInto

      public void getInventoryItemInto(String firebaseId, GetInventoryItemHandler handler)
      A rather roundabout way to update the DetailsActivity with an InventoryItem on update. This sends the InventoryItem from Firebase into the onGetInventoryItem method of the handler, which must implement the GetInventoryItemHandler interface.
      Parameters:
      firebaseId - ID of item to get.
      handler - GetInventoryItemHandler that implements function to call with InventoryItem data, once received.

    • deleteInventoryItem

      public void deleteInventoryItem(User currentUser, String itemId)
      Deletes an InventoryItem from the database.
      Parameters:
      currentUser - The User currently signed in (to whom the item belongs).
      itemId - The ID of the item to delete.

    • addTag

      public void addTag(Tag tag)
      Adds a new Tag to the tags collection.
      Parameters:
      tag - Tag to add to the list of tags.

    • updateTag

      public void updateTag(Tag tag)
      Updates a tag in the database with new data. Effectively, this means overwriting the document at the id of the given Tag with entirely new tag data.
      Parameters:
      tag - The Tag to update.

    • deleteTag

      public void deleteTag(Tag tag, String owner)
      Deletes a specified tag for a given owner.
      Parameters:
      tag - The Tag to be deleted
      owner - The owner of the tag

      Returns:

    • setupTagList

      public com.google.firebase.firestore.ListenerRegistration setupTagList(TagAdapter adapter, User currentUser)
      Sets up a TagAdapter to contain contents of Firebase tags collection, and be automatically updated when the list changes.
      Parameters:
      adapter - the adapter to contain the tags
      Returns:
      a snapshot listener for the collection that will automatically update the adapter

    • setupTagListsForItem

      public com.google.firebase.firestore.ListenerRegistration setupTagListsForItem(TagAdapter appliedAdapter, TagAdapter unappliedAdapter, User currentUser, InventoryItem item)
      Sets up two TagAdapters to contain contents of Firebase tags collection (one for those applied to the item and one for those that aren't), and be automatically updated when the list changes.
      Parameters:
      appliedAdapter - the adapter to contain the tags currently applied to item
      unappliedAdapter - the adapter to contain the tags not currently applied to item
      currentUser - the currently logged-in user
      item - the InventoryItem being considered
      Returns:
      a snapshot listener for the collection that will automatically update the adapter

    • applyTagsToItems

      public void applyTagsToItems(ArrayList<Tag> tags, ArrayList<InventoryItem> items)
      Apply a list of tags to a list of items, correctly populating the fields of both so they reference each other.
      Parameters:
      tags - the list of Tag objects to apply
      items - the list of inventoryItem objects to be tagged
